AF.content: [re: 2 def. of circumcision] 1) symbolic substitute of castration of the son by primitive father (structural) 2) “conducting fossil” for investigating memory of heritage (historical)
AF.linkedContent: [re: 2 def. of circumcision] 1) symbolic substitute of castration of the son by primitive father (structural) 2) “conducting fossil” for investigating memory of heritage (historical)

T.content: tympanum punctures itself (se crève), grafts itself > resists concepts of machine or nature, de coupure ou de corps, resists metaphysics of castration
T.linkedContent: tympanum punctures itself (se crève), grafts itself > resists concepts of machine or nature, de coupure ou de corps, resists metaphysics of castration

F.content: cryptonomy follows contacts, straight lines or surfaces in most economical way, this makes cryptonomic the once inflexible logic of castration
F.linkedContent: cryptonomy follows contacts, straight lines or surfaces in most economical way, this makes cryptonomic the once inflexible logic of castration

DS.content: neither castration nor dissemination can become originary, central signified, dissem. represents affirmation of this nonorigin, it entails, relaunches, “inscribes” castration
DS.linkedContent: neither castration nor dissemination can become originary, central signified, dissem. represents affirmation of this nonorigin, it entails, relaunches, “inscribes” castration

DS.content: [Derrida comes back to i] reads little point as a decapitation right next to castrated pike > capital I (disseminates unity of meaning), ego, ice, écho—plus-je > (I + Dé)irisation
DS.linkedContent: [Derrida comes back to i] reads little point as a decapitation right next to castrated pike > capital I (disseminates unity of meaning), ego, ice, écho—plus-je > (I + Dé)irisation

P.content: Derrida’s pas in Hegel/Heidegger’s circle of art, get across (franchir) circle w/out getting free (s’affranchir) of its law, pas sans pas: circular closure as one that remains open (suffers neither lack nor negativity)
P.linkedContent: Derrida’s pas in Hegel/Heidegger’s circle of art, get across (franchir) circle w/out getting free (s’affranchir) of its law, pas sans pas: circular closure as one that remains open (suffers neither lack nor negativity)

P.content: no deconstruction of labor w/out theory of frame, any market presupposes a process of framing to liberate surplus value > in classical language, lack as product/production of frame
P.linkedContent: no deconstruction of labor w/out theory of frame, any market presupposes a process of framing to liberate surplus value > in classical language, lack as product/production of frame

P.content: le se-protéger-de-oeuvre (ergon), énergie captée, bordée, condition for mastery of PP, self-protection of energeia > energeia not as pure, total presence (prime mover), but as (par)ergon against what’s lacking in it, lack not as a substantial emptiness, but as impossibility of arresting differance in its contour, in a pose, of localizing lack, like metaphysics does, in its proper place: castration as truth (circular) > whether parergon borders (works against) free energy or essential lack, the 2 determinations sont le même (métaphysique)
P.linkedContent: le se-protéger-de-oeuvre (ergon), énergie captée, bordée, condition for mastery of PP, self-protection of energeia > energeia not as pure, total presence (prime mover), but as (par)ergon against what’s lacking in it, lack not as a substantial emptiness, but as impossibility of arresting differance in its contour, in a pose, of localizing lack, like metaphysics does, in its proper place: castration as truth (circular) > whether parergon borders (works against) free energy or essential lack, the 2 determinations sont le même (métaphysique)

P.content: beautiful object, tulip, not lacking in anything, tel point de vue, de but en blanc, plie la totalité à se manquer elle-même > le sans de la coupure pure est sans manque—but for me to experience its totality, my knowledge lacks something—its end (bout); not the absence of end but the trace of the without [end] is origin of beauty; ça donne-le-beau: beauty gives nothing to be seen, sans is not visible, et pourtant il y en a et c’est beau
P.linkedContent: beautiful object, tulip, not lacking in anything, tel point de vue, de but en blanc, plie la totalité à se manquer elle-même > le sans de la coupure pure est sans manque—but for me to experience its totality, my knowledge lacks something—its end (bout); not the absence of end but the trace of the without [end] is origin of beauty; ça donne-le-beau: beauty gives nothing to be seen, sans is not visible, et pourtant il y en a et c’est beau

P.content: free beauty, tulip, cut off from fecundation but not sterile: sterility is determined from the end (as end of end)
P.linkedContent: free beauty, tulip, cut off from fecundation but not sterile: sterility is determined from the end (as end of end)

P.content: kolossos as stationary, impassive stone, link to Freud’s Medusa (castration/erection/apotropaic) [which Derrida attempted to displace in O]
P.linkedContent: kolossos as stationary, impassive stone, link to Freud’s Medusa (castration/erection/apotropaic) [which Derrida attempted to displace in O]

POS.content: castration & mimesis: general title of all works in Dissemination and “White Mythology” [Derrida includes other “themes” on this page as well]
POS.linkedContent: castration & mimesis: general title of all works in Dissemination and “White Mythology” [Derrida includes other “themes” on this page as well]

POS.content: dissemination is play of castration w/out metaphysical/romantic pathos of negativity > dissemination “is” angle of play of castration
POS.linkedContent: dissemination is play of castration w/out metaphysical/romantic pathos of negativity > dissemination “is” angle of play of castration

POS.content: dissemination puts at stake (play) castration’s position as transcendental signifier/signified (phallus, transcendental signifier, as correlate to primary signified, mother’s desire)
POS.linkedContent: dissemination puts at stake (play) castration’s position as transcendental signifier/signified (phallus, transcendental signifier, as correlate to primary signified, mother’s desire)

ROP.content: [quoting EN] difference “w/” Lacan: the lack does not have its place in dissemination
ROP.linkedContent: [quoting EN] difference “w/” Lacan: the lack does not have its place in dissemination

SP.content: if truth is only on the surface, why the fear, la pudeur? woman as suspension of truth & castration > truth-castration as l’affaire de l’homme, his credulity, man is never sufficiently old (assez vieux), dissimulating, or skeptical
SP.linkedContent: if truth is only on the surface, why the fear, la pudeur? woman as suspension of truth & castration > truth-castration as l’affaire de l’homme, his credulity, man is never sufficiently old (assez vieux), dissimulating, or skeptical

SP.content: [re: truth-castration as man’s affair, and woman’s suspension of it] [English translation seems horrible] Derrida is asking that we take off the head (décapitonner) of Lacan’s discourse, w/ its truth speaking, castration & phallocentrism > by deploying metaphorics of veil
SP.linkedContent: [re: truth-castration as man’s affair, and woman’s suspension of it] [English translation seems horrible] Derrida is asking that we take off the head (décapitonner) of Lacan’s discourse, w/ its truth speaking, castration & phallocentrism > by deploying metaphorics of veil

SP.content: woman plays w/ castration, does not believe in it, nor its opposite (much too clever for that),  but she can’t seduce w/out it, needs castration’s effects, but as she plays w/ it, she anticipates her laughter (at man)
SP.linkedContent: woman plays w/ castration, does not believe in it, nor its opposite (much too clever for that), but she can’t seduce w/out it, needs castration’s effects, but as she plays w/ it, she anticipates her laughter (at man)

SP.content: were woman to believe in anti-castration, she would return plus sûrement to the same old machine, phallogocentrism’s attendant, disciple discipliné du maître > “we?” should learn from her
SP.linkedContent: were woman to believe in anti-castration, she would return plus sûrement to the same old machine, phallogocentrism’s attendant, disciple discipliné du maître > “we?” should learn from her

SP.content: castration describes a margin whose consequences are incalculable
SP.linkedContent: castration describes a margin whose consequences are incalculable

SP.content: the becoming-female, Christian, an epoch in parenthesis, a woman castrates and plays at her castration, feigns castration (at once suffered & inflicted) [see HYMEN]
SP.linkedContent: the becoming-female, Christian, an epoch in parenthesis, a woman castrates and plays at her castration, feigns castration (at once suffered & inflicted) [see HYMEN]

SP.content: castratism of the Church, excision (Ausschneidung), hostile to life (lebensfeindlich): so, if woman is life (femina vita), Christianity hostile to woman > la castration est une opération de la femme contre la femme, non moins que de chaque sexe contre soi et contre l’autre
SP.linkedContent: castratism of the Church, excision (Ausschneidung), hostile to life (lebensfeindlich): so, if woman is life (femina vita), Christianity hostile to woman > la castration est une opération de la femme contre la femme, non moins que de chaque sexe contre soi et contre l’autre

SP.content: Nietzsche’s 3 “positions” on woman: 1. woman is figure of falsehood, man as phallus is truth ; man fears castrated woman 2. woman is the figure of truth, plays w/ truth as a fetish ; man fears castrating woman 3. woman as artist, Dionysiac, dissimulatrice, castration doesn’t take place; love affirming woman
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s 3 “positions” on woman: 1. woman is figure of falsehood, man as phallus is truth ; man fears castrated woman 2. woman is the figure of truth, plays w/ truth as a fetish ; man fears castrating woman 3. woman as artist, Dionysiac, dissimulatrice, castration doesn’t take place; love affirming woman

SP.content: hymen’s graphic, that of the pharmakon, inscribes castration’s effects w/in itself, w/out being reduced to it
SP.linkedContent: hymen’s graphic, that of the pharmakon, inscribes castration’s effects w/in itself, w/out being reduced to it

ATIA.content: Descartes’ 2 criteria (he calls them “methods”) for differentiating authentic from mimetic simulacrum of automaton (still govern method of Lacan & Heidegger): 1) the inability to respond 2) a lack which is not the lack of man, the lacking of the lack of man
ATIA.linkedContent: Descartes’ 2 criteria (he calls them “methods”) for differentiating authentic from mimetic simulacrum of automaton (still govern method of Lacan & Heidegger): 1) the inability to respond 2) a lack which is not the lack of man, the lacking of the lack of man

ATIA.content: from Descartes to Heidegger, nonresponse: mechanicity of programming, deficiency, lack
ATIA.linkedContent: from Descartes to Heidegger, nonresponse: mechanicity of programming, deficiency, lack

ATIA.content: Lacan designates castration complex as Freud’s scientific (nonmythological) original sin (being subjected to the signifier, a nonmastery that gives human mastery over animals)
ATIA.linkedContent: Lacan designates castration complex as Freud’s scientific (nonmythological) original sin (being subjected to the signifier, a nonmastery that gives human mastery over animals)

PS.content: for Artaud, swollen ego of cock > separate from me: “a true man has no sex” [swelling of sex as castration]
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, swollen ego of cock > separate from me: “a true man has no sex” [swelling of sex as castration]

DIF.content: if differance is [Heidegger’s Durchstreichung of Being], it reserves itself, never offered to the present: exceeds order of truth, not a hole in topology of castration [p. 21 differance is not]
DIF.linkedContent: if differance is [Heidegger’s Durchstreichung of Being], it reserves itself, never offered to the present: exceeds order of truth, not a hole in topology of castration [p. 21 differance is not]

O.content: [nonsynonymous synonyms] add a supplementary 4th term, the more or the less, opening of square (not a cross, not closed square) > often associated w/ castration, this 4 of dissemination: an outside of castration (fall w/ no return, no restricted economy), a triangle open on its 4th side, splayed square (carré écarté) loosens up circle/triangle, de-limits them, re-cites them
O.linkedContent: [nonsynonymous synonyms] add a supplementary 4th term, the more or the less, opening of square (not a cross, not closed square) > often associated w/ castration, this 4 of dissemination: an outside of castration (fall w/ no return, no restricted economy), a triangle open on its 4th side, splayed square (carré écarté) loosens up circle/triangle, de-limits them, re-cites them

O.content: castration has always been metaphysically interpreted/arrested by full speech, logocentrism, intersubjective triad
O.linkedContent: castration has always been metaphysically interpreted/arrested by full speech, logocentrism, intersubjective triad

O.content: if “assumption” of castration is same as denial of it: “apotropaics would always have one more surprise up its sleeve (plus d’une suprise)”
O.linkedContent: if “assumption” of castration is same as denial of it: “apotropaics would always have one more surprise up its sleeve (plus d’une suprise)”

REST.content: philosophico-psychoanalytic concept of fetishism, opposition between fetish & thing, castration as truth of truth, sexual decidability
REST.linkedContent: philosophico-psychoanalytic concept of fetishism, opposition between fetish & thing, castration as truth of truth, sexual decidability

REST.content: logic of detachment as cut (opposition, leads to suturing-sublation, maintains problematic of castration truth) vs. logic of detachment as stricture (is tout autre, interlacing of differance of [or as] stricture, no suture, haunting, neither empty nor full, l’argument-de-la-gaine, can’t accommodate the couple, ces coupes oppositionelles, the ghost leases, le, la, les double(s) band-)

TR.content: de Man: dispossession in writing due to arbitrary power of signifier, from point of view of subject, this can only be experienced as beheading, dismemberment, castration
TR.linkedContent: de Man: dispossession in writing due to arbitrary power of signifier, from point of view of subject, this can only be experienced as beheading, dismemberment, castration

AFR.content: Condillac’s theory of analogy (operation of remarking): supply a language’s defects > remarks anteriority in the fact, an anteriority (of the fact) that becomes lacking in itself > supply what is necessary, is missing (il faut), but [remark] also presents itself as surplus value, a superabundance, frivolous futility > makes all commerce possible (as value & sign)
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s theory of analogy (operation of remarking): supply a language’s defects > remarks anteriority in the fact, an anteriority (of the fact) that becomes lacking in itself > supply what is necessary, is missing (il faut), but [remark] also presents itself as surplus value, a superabundance, frivolous futility > makes all commerce possible (as value & sign)

BSi.content: priapism is infinite ithyphallism, foreign to finitude of erection (finitude makes erection possible) > thus, is detumescence castration?
BSi.linkedContent: priapism is infinite ithyphallism, foreign to finitude of erection (finitude makes erection possible) > thus, is detumescence castration?

BSi.content: Lacan: Oedipus story, a less cretinizing (abêtissant) version of Original Sin > Derrida wonders [coyly] whether everything in BS deals w/ castration
BSi.linkedContent: Lacan: Oedipus story, a less cretinizing (abêtissant) version of Original Sin > Derrida wonders [coyly] whether everything in BS deals w/ castration

ATAP.content: from Kant to Freud, no sexual difference (pas de différence) in castration or emasculation (Entmannung) [either one has male genital or one is castrated], only the masculine!
ATAP.linkedContent: from Kant to Freud, no sexual difference (pas de différence) in castration or emasculation (Entmannung) [either one has male genital or one is castrated], only the masculine!

ATAP.content: castration [of reason], a metaphor/simulacrum, concerns phallus (not penis/clitoris); Bemächtigungstrieb
ATAP.linkedContent: castration [of reason], a metaphor/simulacrum, concerns phallus (not penis/clitoris); Bemächtigungstrieb

CIR.content: see yourself overrunning discourse on castration and its supposed substitute
CIR.linkedContent: see yourself overrunning discourse on castration and its supposed substitute

EU.content: Glas: generalized fetishism, pull of the discourse of castration toward affirmative dissemination [also continues pursuing project of grammatology, etc.]
EU.linkedContent: Glas: generalized fetishism, pull of the discourse of castration toward affirmative dissemination [also continues pursuing project of grammatology, etc.]

SPEC.content: index of original normality [at this point of Beyond…] is the “primitive,” not child: primitives don’t face death [?], anxiety about death has no proper content
SPEC.linkedContent: index of original normality [at this point of Beyond…] is the “primitive,” not child: primitives don’t face death [?], anxiety about death has no proper content

SPEC.content: death is the analogon of castration > castration not incompatible w/ thesis of death drive if one refers to syntaxic articulation of athesis: Derrida’s pointing to “it” at this moment
SPEC.linkedContent: death is the analogon of castration > castration not incompatible w/ thesis of death drive if one refers to syntaxic articulation of athesis: Derrida’s pointing to “it” at this moment

SPEC.content: w/ Causa, l’Autre Chose—no opposition btwn pleasure & unpleasure, w/in & beyond, life & death: graphics of strictural supplement not oppositional, knowns no negation, no lack; in graphics, desire is sans “sans,” is of a “sans sans sans”
SPEC.linkedContent: w/ Causa, l’Autre Chose—no opposition btwn pleasure & unpleasure, w/in & beyond, life & death: graphics of strictural supplement not oppositional, knowns no negation, no lack; in graphics, desire is sans “sans,” is of a “sans sans sans”

FV.content: for Freud, dreams of nakedness don’t exhibit penis or absence of penis but absence of phallus, absence of attribute supplementing a possible fault, absence of colossal double > following chain is indicated: truth-unveiled-woman-castration-shame [Schreber]
FV.linkedContent: for Freud, dreams of nakedness don’t exhibit penis or absence of penis but absence of phallus, absence of attribute supplementing a possible fault, absence of colossal double > following chain is indicated: truth-unveiled-woman-castration-shame [Schreber]

FV.content: [Derrida’s syntactical deconstruction of Lacan] re: letter, manque à sa place [missing from its place] becomes manque a sa place [lack has its place]
FV.linkedContent: [Derrida’s syntactical deconstruction of Lacan] re: letter, manque à sa place [missing from its place] becomes manque a sa place [lack has its place]

FV.content: “Seminar” insists on topos, single proper itinerary of letter, if meaning [in the general sense] is indifferent to letter, meaning of the letter is not, meaning of letter as truth itself
FV.linkedContent: “Seminar” insists on topos, single proper itinerary of letter, if meaning [in the general sense] is indifferent to letter, meaning of the letter is not, meaning of letter as truth itself

FV.content: not naive topology but still a topos, Heideggerian-like veiled/unveiled castration placed at the hole (trou) of the woman, letter comes back to Being, to the nothing that is the opening btwn woman’s legs (Queen)
FV.linkedContent: not naive topology but still a topos, Heideggerian-like veiled/unveiled castration placed at the hole (trou) of the woman, letter comes back to Being, to the nothing that is the opening btwn woman’s legs (Queen)

FV.content: Derrida on Lacan: circulation, acquitting of a debt, a proper place [not naive, empirical topology], detour from [woman’s] hole to itself permits signified to return to its origin—indivisible locality, signifier must never be lost, divided, fragmented
FV.linkedContent: Derrida on Lacan: circulation, acquitting of a debt, a proper place [not naive, empirical topology], detour from [woman’s] hole to itself permits signified to return to its origin—indivisible locality, signifier must never be lost, divided, fragmented

FV.content: circular itinerary, Dupin & analyst find letter where they expect it: Queen wants letter-fetish brought back to her, exchanges one fetish for another w/out spending—because there’s equivalence here (assurance of return): circle of restricted economy, stricture of the ring
FV.linkedContent: circular itinerary, Dupin & analyst find letter where they expect it: Queen wants letter-fetish brought back to her, exchanges one fetish for another w/out spending—because there’s equivalence here (assurance of return): circle of restricted economy, stricture of the ring

FV.content: castration-truth is that which contracts itself (stricture of the ring): brings signifier, fetish, phallus, letter back into their oikos, familiar dwelling, proper place
FV.linkedContent: castration-truth is that which contracts itself (stricture of the ring): brings signifier, fetish, phallus, letter back into their oikos, familiar dwelling, proper place

FV.content: the lack never lacks a place: indivisible circulation of proper
FV.linkedContent: the lack never lacks a place: indivisible circulation of proper

FV.content: lack does not have its place in dissemination
FV.linkedContent: lack does not have its place in dissemination

FV.content: for Lacan, Femininity is the Truth (of) castration, best figure of castration, because in logic of signifier it (elle) has always already been castrated > Femininity “leaves” something in circulation (here the letter), detaches something she never had, brought back to itself
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, Femininity is the Truth (of) castration, best figure of castration, because in logic of signifier it (elle) has always already been castrated > Femininity “leaves” something in circulation (here the letter), detaches something she never had, brought back to itself

FV.content: this 1st castration (pre-castration) affects w/ castration/femininity whoever holds the letter
FV.linkedContent: this 1st castration (pre-castration) affects w/ castration/femininity whoever holds the letter

FV.content: for Derrida, letter can always not arrive > Lacan’s symbolic, Lacan’s castration, protects letter from its divisibility/fragmentation
FV.linkedContent: for Derrida, letter can always not arrive > Lacan’s symbolic, Lacan’s castration, protects letter from its divisibility/fragmentation

FV.content: Bonaparte falls back onto dogmatic imprudence (appeal to author’s unconscious), Lacan falls back, w/ incomparable philosophical vigilance, onto Truth > [both Bonaparte & Lacan] castration of mother as ultimate meaning & proper site of letter: “real intersubjectivity,” “solution in broad daylight”—proper as relation to lack itself, in proper place/body
FV.linkedContent: Bonaparte falls back onto dogmatic imprudence (appeal to author’s unconscious), Lacan falls back, w/ incomparable philosophical vigilance, onto Truth > [both Bonaparte & Lacan] castration of mother as ultimate meaning & proper site of letter: “real intersubjectivity,” “solution in broad daylight”—proper as relation to lack itself, in proper place/body

FV.content: the 2 truths lean on, support each other (s’étaient): 1) adequation, circular return, garde et regarde, circuit of pact, control, guardianship (la garde) of the phallus as guardianship of the lack 2) veiling-unveiling as structure of lack, a proper place: les contours étant-la place du manque à être
FV.linkedContent: the 2 truths lean on, support each other (s’étaient): 1) adequation, circular return, garde et regarde, circuit of pact, control, guardianship (la garde) of the phallus as guardianship of the lack 2) veiling-unveiling as structure of lack, a proper place: les contours étant-la place du manque à être

FV.content: [in Purloined Letter] Queen wishes to play on 2 contracts [must be read elsewhere?]: Queen’s desire to retain (garder) or refind the letter doubles her pact w/ the King
FV.linkedContent: [in Purloined Letter] Queen wishes to play on 2 contracts [must be read elsewhere?]: Queen’s desire to retain (garder) or refind the letter doubles her pact w/ the King

FV.content: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]
FV.linkedContent: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]

FV.content: the 2 truths: adequation (original contract: acquitting of debt), unveiling (lack on basis of which contract contracts in order to reappropriate what’s been detached)
FV.linkedContent: the 2 truths: adequation (original contract: acquitting of debt), unveiling (lack on basis of which contract contracts in order to reappropriate what’s been detached)

FV.content: w/out return, divisibility rebels against lack
FV.linkedContent: w/out return, divisibility rebels against lack

FV.content: Lacan’s authentic: “appel propre du vide”
FV.linkedContent: Lacan’s authentic: “appel propre du vide”

FV.content: for Lacan, ideal process of analysis: “realization” of full speech as assumption of desire (of castration)
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, ideal process of analysis: “realization” of full speech as assumption of desire (of castration)

FV.content: [re: psychoanalysis] institution built on male child’s experience > at stage of genital organization, there’s only maleness (antithesis isn’t femaleness but being castrated): phallogocentrism is no accident/error, its old, enormous root must be accounted for [described] > but, its description is a “participant” when it induces a practice, ethics, institution, a politics that insures truth of a tradition
